name: Cu Chi Tunnels
description: A somber reminder of the realities of war, but it also showcased the incredible strength and determination of the Vietnamese people.

name: Bui Vien Street
description: Bui Vien Walking Street, a nightlife tourist attraction in Saigon, is an ideal venue for Western guests and young Saigonese to come to eat and hang out every time they go down the street.

name: Bitexco Financial Tower
description: The view from this sky deck is amazing. I love this city and enjoying the views from this building is a definite must.

name: Nguyen Hue Street
description: A large park, very nice and bustling place in the evening. At night the city is very cool, walking here is great.

name: Ho Chi Minh Square
description: A walk in the evening through the square is refreshing. The lotus in the centre of the square is so beautifully done.

name: Pham Ngu Lao Street
description: You have plenty of restaurants, bars, agencies to plan further trips, and nightclubs to hang out in the evening.

name: Đường Đồng Khởi
description: During the period of the Vietnam War, it was named 'Tu Do Street', meaning 'Freedom Street'.

name: Binh Quoi Village
description: The Binh Quoi village cost about 110,000VND to get there using Grab car service and 130,000VND to get back.

name: Temple of Ten Thousand Buddhas (Chua Van Phat)
description: This temple was truly a gem. It has several floors and as you go up, it just becomes more beautiful.

name: Đài tưởng niệm Bồ tát Thích Quảng Đức
description: A memorial to the monk who set himself on fire to protest the persecution of Buddhists in Vietnam.

name: Saigon River
description: In the city the traffic around the river is non-stop so it's not the most peaceful place to walk along.

name: Ben Dinh Tunnels
description: The shooting range was awful, but it also added to the ambiance and experience of being inside the tunnel.

name: Notre Dame Cathedral of Saigon
description: 1880s Catholic cathedral built with French bricks & featuring 58m-tall Romanesque bell towers.

name: Saigon Skydeck
description: Nice place to visit, not so expensive. Only minus was that the actual skydeck was under repair.

name: Takashimaya
description: Airy, posh shopping center with designer boutiques, gourmet eateries & a glamorous vibe.

name: Saigon Opera House
description: A beautiful French colonial building that hosts a variety of performances including opera, ballet, and traditional Vietnamese music.

name: Jade Emperor Pagoda
description: A Taoist pagoda known for its intricate carvings and statues, dedicated to the Jade Emperor, the supreme Taoist god.

name: Saigon Central Post Office
description: A grand colonial-era post office with beautiful architecture, designed by Gustave Eiffel, and still in operation today.

name: Ho Chi Minh City Museum
description: A museum showcasing the history and culture of Ho Chi Minh City, housed in a beautiful colonial building.

name: Fine Arts Museum
description: A museum featuring a diverse collection of Vietnamese art, including contemporary works and traditional pieces.

name: Ton Duc Thang University
description: A museum that provides insights into Vietnam's rich history and cultural heritage, with artifacts from various periods.

name: Lotte Mart
description: A museum that provides insights into Vietnam's rich history and cultural heritage, with artifacts from various periods.

name: Shwedagon Pagoda
description: Historic 99-m-high Buddhist temple plated in gold, offering tours, a visitor center & an exhibit.

name: Sule Pagoda
description: Gilded, historic Buddhist pagoda with an ornate exterior & multiple shrines & statues.

name: Kandawgyi Lake
description: 150-acre colonial-era reservoir with a park, paths for exercise & views of the Shwedagon Pagoda.

name: Bogyoke Aung San Market
description: Lively bazaar in a multistory colonial building, with vendors selling antiques, jewelry, art & food.

name: Botahtaung Pagoda
description: The Botataung pagoda on the banks of the Bago river in downtown Yangon is one of the city’s most highly revered temples.

name: Yangon Chinatown
description: Chinatown in Yangon is primarily known for its streets lined with vendors and food stalls that offer an array of street foods, local delicacies, and Chinese cuisine.

name: Maha Bandula Park
description: The Maha Bandula Park or Maha Bandula Garden is a public park, located in downtown Yangon, Burma.

name: Yangon Zoo
description: Sizable zoological garden featuring mammals, birds & reptiles & a diverse array of plant species.

name: Inya Lake
description: Tranquil, romantic lake with parks on the banks & a sailing club for sunset cruises & rowing.

name: Mandalay Palace
description: The Mandalay Palace, also known as the Mya Nan San Kyaw, is the last royal palace of the Burmese monarchy.

name: Kuthodaw Pagoda
description: A Buddhist stupa in Mandalay, Myanmar, known for housing the world's largest book, consisting of 729 marble slabs inscribed with Buddhist teachings.

name: U Bein Bridge
description: U Bein Bridge is the world’s longest teakwood bridge, stretching across Taungthaman Lake.

name: Mahamuni Buddha Temple
description: Revered temple complex & pilgrimage site featuring the sizable Mahamuni Buddha statue on a throne.

name: Mandalay Hill
description: A Buddhist pilgrimage site, this prominent hill features ample pagodas, monasteries & scenic views.

name: Ananda Temple
description: Huge, stately Buddhist temple built in 1105, with notable architecture, sculptures & paintings.

name: Shwezigon Pagoda
description: 11th-century Buddhist pagoda featuring a monumental stupa covered in gold leaf & intricate carvings.

name: Dhammayangyi Temple
description: Imposing temple built in the 12th century, featuring shrines, Buddha statues & walkways.

name: That Bin Nyu Temple
description: Towering 12th-century Buddhist temple, 60 m. tall, with ornate details & receding terraces.

name: Sulamani Temple
description: Stately, 12th-century stone Buddhist temple with scenic views, elaborate carvings & statues.

name: Bagan Golden Palace
description: Arimadanapura Palace, also called the Bagan Golden Palace, is a royal palace in Bagan, Myanmar.

name: Inle Lake
description: Large lake & cultural destination with quaint floating villages, monasteries & handicrafts.

name: Phaung Daw Oo Pagoda
description: A revered Buddhist pagoda located on Inle Lake, known for its five sacred Buddha images and annual boat festival.

name: National Kandawgyi Gardens
description: Modeled after English gardens such as Kew, this Alpine garden features woods, lakes & many orchids.

name: Ngapali Beach
description: Sandy, palm-tree-lined beach offering swimming & sunbathing, plus views of the local fishing boats.

name: Shwe Oo Min Monastery
description: Shwe Oo Min Paya, popularly called Buddha Cave, is a Buddhist cave complex located close to the city of Kalaw in Myanmar.

name: Mya Sein Taung Pagoda
description: Mya Sein Taung Pagoda is a Buddhist temple in Taunggyi Township, Taunggyi District, Shan State.

name: Pindaya Caves
description: A series of limestone caves housing thousands of Buddha images, with a serene atmosphere and scenic views.

name: Kyaiktiyo Pagoda - Golden Rock
description: Small Buddhist pagoda sitting on top of a large granite boulder covered with gold leaves.

name: Mount Kyar Inn
description: Mount Kyar Inn, located in the enchanting town of Hpa-An, is a must-visit destination for tourists seeking a blend of natural beauty and cultural immersion.

name: Mt Popa
description: Volcanic peak & site of the iconic, gilded Popa Taung Kalat monastery perched on a rock spur.

name: Kyaikkhami Yae Le Pagoda
description: Kyaikkhami Pagoda (Burmese: ကျိုက္ခမီဘုရား) is a prominent Buddhist pagoda located in Kyaikkhami, Mon State, Myanmar.
